What Our Travelers Says

  • "Switzerland is a bit of a mystery to most people in Europe and maybe even around the world. But one thing is for sure, the Swiss, and Switzerland is famous for quite a few things. Lindt chocolate in your country, or just know Switzerland’s fame for chocolate production, there is no going past it. Switzerland is one of the most famous producers of chocolate in the world. If you love cheese, aside from maybe France, this is one of the best places to eat!"

    -Jackie Q.
    Zurich, Switzerland

  • "We were 3 friends and family had 11 days holidays at Thailand. We stayed at Pattaya, Phuket and Bangkok. The best of all these places was Phuket. The beaches and places at Phuket is simply awesome and a must visit. The only thing to check is the hotel stay. When anyone book the hotel please check for the numbers persons in one room. All the portals will allow you to add the number of persons to be accommodated in one room but on arrival at the hotel, they will tell that they will not allow more than 3 persons and charge you extra for every extra person. They will also charge for complimentary breakfast as well. Further, the hotel will collect a security money of 1000 Baht per room which is refundable. You will also be charged for eating any snacks and beverages kept in the room except the tea and coffee. One must enquire few tour agents and negotiate the rate before finalizing for any sight seeing tours. Phi Phi Island, James Bond Island, Aonang, etc. at Phuket are awesome and a must see."

    - Jhon Doe
    Pattaya., Thailand

  • "From the idyllic beaches of Bali to the chaotic melting pot of Jakarta, Indonesia is a diverse Southeast Asian gem. West Java and Sumatra are home to some of the most beautiful tropical forests in the world – perfect for jungle trekking. The Prambanan collection of Hindu temples in Yogyakarta will astound you with their architecture and aura of spirituality. Capital city Jakarta is a cultural and political hub that’s jam-packed with museums, performing arts centers, and traditional food stalls."

    - Jessica Doe
    Bali, Indonesia
